title: SQLOR Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLOR Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
OR
The
OR
command is used with WHERE to include 
rows where either condition is true.
The following SQL statement selects all fields from "Customers" where city is 
"Berlin" OR city is "München":
Example
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE City='Berlin' OR City='München';

Reference

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE City='Berlin' OR City='München';

The correct definition of OR
The
OR
command is used with WHERE to include 
rows where either condition is 'true'.

quiz.question: What is where city?
options:
"Berlin" OR city is "München":
Example

WHERE City='Berlin' OR City='München';

quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of where city is '"Berlin" OR city is "München":

WHERE City='Berlin' OR City='München';

summary: This tutorial covers SQLOR Keyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLOR Keyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLOR Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
